items.title: Exercise 1: Recruitment Progress Update (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Internal HR Update: Project Manager Recruitment

Status Update:
- Having reviewed over 100 applications, we have successfully shortlisted 5 candidates for the final interview stage.
- Interviews are scheduled for next Tuesday and Wednesday. Hired for their extensive experience in Agile methodologies, these candidates represent the top 5% of our talent pool.
- Reference checks are currently in progress for the top two choices. 

Onboarding Prep:
Knowing that the successful candidate will need immediate access to the Jira board, I have requested IT to prepare the accounts in advance. Having completed the initial induction plan, we are now assigning a 'buddy' from the senior admin team to assist during the first week.

questions.question: How many candidates have been shortlisted for the final interview stage?
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'we have successfully shortlisted 5 candidates'.

questions.question: What has already been completed regarding the new hire's integration?
questions.explanation: Doc A says: 'Having completed the initial induction plan...'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: HR Terminology. What is the process of integrating a new employee into the organisation called?
items.explanation: Onboarding is the term for integrating a new hire.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Induction. What is the main purpose of a 'buddy' during onboarding?
options: To monitor the new hire's work 24/7
To provide informal support and help the new hire settle in
To conduct the formal performance review
items.explanation: A buddy provides informal guidance and support to help the new starter adjust.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We need to ___ a job description and then ___ the candidate's references.'
items.explanation: Standard HR tasks involve 'drafting a job description' and 'checking references'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Present Participle. Combine these two sentences into one using an -ing participle clause: 'She works as an HR administrator. She manages all interview schedules.'
items.modelAnswer: Working as an HR administrator, she manages all interview schedules.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Perfect Participle. Combine these two sentences into one using a 'Having + Past Participle' clause: 'The recruiter reviewed the CVs. Then he sent the shortlist to the manager.'
items.modelAnswer: Having reviewed the CVs, the recruiter sent the shortlist to the manager.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Data. Based on Doc A, list the two things that have been prepared or requested for the new hire's first week.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Jira board access (requested from IT). 2. Initial induction plan (completed).

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally ask a candidate to provide a missing reference?
options: Could you please provide the contact details for your second reference by the end of the day?
I wish you had sent the reference.
items.explanation: This is a polite and direct request using professional language.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Interview Invitation Email. Write a short email (50-70 words) to a candidate inviting them to a second interview on Thursday at 10 AM. Include the location (Microsoft Teams).
items.modelAnswer: Dear Alex, following our initial screening call, I’m pleased to invite you to a second interview this Thursday at 10 AM UK time. The interview will be conducted via Microsoft Teams; please find the link attached. We look forward to discussing the role further with you. Best regards, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Candidate Vetting. What is a 'screening call'?
options: A short initial call to check basic suitability
items.explanation: A screening call is a brief initial interview used to filter candidates.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Onboarding Intro. Record a 2-minute audio welcoming a new employee. Use at least one participle clause (e.g., 'Having joined the team...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Warmth, Clarity of induction steps, Correct use of Participle Clause.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Candidate Feedback. Record a 60-second clip providing neutral feedback to a candidate who was not successful. Use 'Having considered your application...' to start.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Diplomatic tone, Clear message, Use of Participle Clause.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Recruitment Summary Report (Portfolio). Write a 150-word summary of a recent recruitment campaign. Use at least three participle clauses to keep the report concise.
items.modelAnswer:
Recruitment Summary: Senior Ops Coordinator

Having launched the campaign in early March, we received 75 applications through our corporate portal. Working closely with the department head, I filtered the applicants based on their previous administrative experience. 

Screened for their technical proficiency, 10 candidates were invited to an initial call. Having completed the first round of interviews, we shortlisted three exceptional individuals for the final assessment. 

Knowing that the team is currently understaffed, we prioritized the reference checks and offered the position to Sarah Jenkins. Having accepted the offer, Sarah is scheduled to start on the 1st of next month. We have already initiated the onboarding process, including the IT setup and the assignment of an office buddy.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Onboarding Checklist Template. Complete a checklist for a 'New Starter'. Include: Pre-arrival, Day 1, and Week 1 tasks.
items.modelAnswer: Pre-arrival: Laptop setup, Email creation. Day 1: Office tour, HR paperwork. Week 1: 1-to-1 with manager, System training.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define 'Shortlisting'. 2) What is an 'Induction'? 3) Complete the participle clause: '___ (finish) the report, I sent it to HR.' 4) What is the role of an office 'buddy'?
items.modelAnswer: 1) Selecting top candidates from a pool. 2) Introduction to a new role. 3) Having finished. 4) To provide informal support to a new hire.
